result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 30, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Request to schedule
INITIAL SCHEDULING ORDER
No violent or disorderly conduct with victim: DAS or children. Absolute sobriety.

Activity:Adjourned inital appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

01:36 PM Defendant John A. Scheehle in court by phone with attorney Richard Russell McCue by video.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads not guilty. Amended cash bond conditions of  no violent or disorderly conduct with victim: DAS or children. Absolute sobriety. Defendant to sign bond no later than June 24, 2022 at 3:00pm.  Matter to be set.

01:45 PM Defendant John A. Scheehle in court in person.  David Zarwell appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. Court finds the Defendant indigent and appoints attorney Richard McCue. Defendant to reimburse the County $30 per month.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Activity:Initial appearance

01:27 PM Defendant John A. Scheehle in court by phone.  Emmeline Lee and Margarett Ginocchio  appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Sworn testimony of John A. Scheehle. Cash bond of $150 set with conditions of no contact directly or indirectly with victims S.B. or J.B. , his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere.
